column4: @ghuff You are demented. Completely demented. Good luck with... all... that.

@ghuff Nope, criminality and skin color have no inherent link. The criminal blighting of our AA neighborhoods in the US is a complicated, extremely difficult to diagnose and solve problem, but just abandoning those neighborhoods to violence is the worst answer.
@ghuff Jesus. Do you have so little self-respect that you have to sink to this level of obtuseness? Seriously?
@ghuff I mean, we've demonstrated pretty conclusively here that you're immune to facts and evidence, so shrug indeed.
@ghuff Golly, that seems a lot like vague handwaving and completely unfalsifiable assertions. Oh wait that's exactly what it is.
@ghuff Yeah, it's almost as if AA suspects are disproportionately involved in violent crime and disproportionately likely to assault police with lethal force, leading to fatal encounters. Huh.
@ghuff He is absolutely making fun of the driver. And yes, unlike most other jobs, getting salty and making fun of people as a cop can get you fired.

@ghuff Yep, it'd be interesting to dig into that more. For example, 100% of the murders and non-fatal shootings I've responded to (dozens) have involved AA as suspect, victim, and usually both. All of my felon in possession of a firearm arrests were AA.
@ghuff Oh also here's another https://t.co/zwSZf6hoWJ
@ghuff lol, salty cop is making fun of the driver, who in fact has said a dumb. Why didn't you answer the question about officer Smith?

@ghuff Does this mean I might be more likely to grab a non-compliant AA suspect? Maybe? But I still have to articulate a reasonable basis for what I do based on specific objective facts, and skin color is not a legal basis for anything.
@ghuff Jesus christ do you not get tired of shifting goal posts?

@ghuff Do you somehow think I haven't read it before now? And yes it does. The entire proportionality argument is based upon pretending that suspect behavior has nothing to do with officer decision making. That's what the "criticism" is.

@ghuff You can watch the video. They were on his neck too. Why are you insisting on a new, irrelevant question instead of acknowledging that your first was answered definitively? But sure, yes, they all made choices too. That doesn't absolve the officers.
@ghuff Yeah, I've seen the "criticism," all of it just doubles down on the assumption that suspect behavior somehow plays no part in police decision making. This is not credible criticism.
@ghuff Timpa died almost identically to Floyd. His death was arguably worse because he called on himself for help.
@ghuff Also you don't need to believe anyone's word, the BWC video is public record.

@ghuff Irrelevant. What's relevant is what occurred. Shaver wasn't shot on sight. The cops were poorly organized and gave conflicting, confusing commands that Shaver was unable to understand or follow; he was shot when he dropped his hands to waistband.
@ghuff I don't know, maybe we should try to do some rigorous research that controls for suspect behavior? https://t.co/0T34mjxbYK
@ghuff Please watch this and tell me exactly when the officer should feel threatened: https://t.co/afjQOXGSlY

@ghuff No, you have no idea what you're talking about - unless you've attended the MPD academy? If they're so jumpy then how do they have thousands of violent felony arrests with single digit % having force used period?
@ghuff That's pretty cool how you made up a rule that means you get to just ignore evidence you don't like. Can I do that too?
@ghuff You're invoking recklessly vague language in service of pretending that the police are somehow a worse problem for AAs than criminal violence.
@ghuff Non sequitur. You asked for examples of a particular phenomenon and I provided.

@ghuff Dude, they were in far southwest Minneapolis, a very very white affluent neighborhood. Does it bother you that you keep making shit up to fit a square peg into a round hole? Why not just not make things up?
@ghuff And it should make you wonder what's going on that you've apparently never heard of Shaver/Timpa. It's almost like the national media is carefully crafting a narrative by selective reporting.
@ghuff This is completely insane. Part of his conviction was his testimony that he opened fire before recognizing any information at all. He shot at a silhouette.
@ghuff No, we don't. The evidence is very clear that force is determined by suspect behavior.
@ghuff And quoting "protect and serve" doesn't mean black people just have carte blanche to shoot at, stab, etc officers. Again, simply comply and the chance of any force being used drops to near 0.
@ghuff Lol dude. Justine Damond. Daniel Shaver. Tony Timpa. Etc. Cops absolutely fuck up, but it's not racial in any kind of systemic way.

@ghuff Yeah except even in the instances people are most angry about actual resistance is trivially obvious. Shaver was actually trying to be compliant when he was killed, but he was white. Damond was just killed immediately, also white.

@ghuff You're right, they shouldn't. The evidence is very clear that if you comply, the chances of any force being used on you are nearly 0 (unfortunately, humans being fallible, it's not 0.) .01% of ARRESTS result in fatal OIS, much less calls for service.

@ghuff Fatalities related to the police are 3% of violent deaths for AA at most, and almost none of those 3% are anything other than straightforward.  Police are objectively not a threat to black lives.
@ghuff This is such a deeply bad faith response. You are faced with a fact you don't like so you just... pretend it's not there by handwaving in the general direction of uncertainty.

@ghuff Just... stop acting like you give a shit about black lives. 7,700 black homicide victims in 2019, higher yet in 2020. You don't care, never have, never will. As long as it stays in the hood you can ignore it.

@ghuff Why do you think the CDC is so wildly wrong? On what basis do you allege that the known is completely the opposite of the unknowns, whatever their size? Is it really your position that Southside Chicago is just exactly the same as a sleepy suburb?

@ghuff Does it bother you to retreat into non-sequiturs? Is it really seriously your contention that the murder rate amongst white/Asian populations is exactly the same as for AA? Can you find literally any evidence to support that? Other than just gesturing vaguely at "unknown"?
@ghuff When of course the most reasonable course would be to consider it likely that the "unknowns" follow the contour of the known unless you have some reason to posit it wouldn't.

@ghuff What crimes are they committing? I don't "target" people, I target crime. Your hypothetical is insane. Are there oath keeper crews engaging in nightly gunfire? Oath keeper robbery crews out hitting licks?

@ghuff I mean just by the numbers they're not a significant threat. Not zero, but most of the people that murder cops are armed felons that don't want to go to prison. 2A nutbags are no different from, fr ex, al-Issa or Paddock.
@ghuff In the very unlikely event you run into an armed psychopath at the moment he's gone on a murder spree that's obviously dangerous. Also water is wet.

@ghuff This is what you've got? Homicide is the LEADING CAUSE OF DEATH for AA males 15-34 according to CDC dude. Jesus. Who the fuck do you think is getting killed in Chicago, Philly, Minneapolis, Baltimore?
@ghuff What is an "oath keeper" neighborhood? Where is one? What is the violent crime rate there? Why does that neighborhood rate police resources above and beyond Southside Chicago?
@ghuff In 6.5 years of city policing I had one white robbery suspect (out of hundreds) described to me. I found and arrested him. If a victim describes a black suspect should I stop a white person?
@ghuff AA people are 50% of the murder victims/suspects in this country. That % is much higher in our cities. Should the police direct their efforts to areas with more crime or less?
@ghuff Use of force is driven by suspect behavior. AA suspects disproportionately use lethal force on police and face it in return. Why are you struggling with this?

@ghuff The tiny % of the population committing a disproportionate amount of lethal assaults on police means that by your own racially-focused narrative, police SHOULD be afraid of AA individuals, as that pop is disproportionately likely to assault.
@ghuff Luckily police don't operate on a racial basis. Use of force is principally driven by suspect behavior, not skin color. HTH.

@ghuff How do people twist themselves into knots like this? 37% minimum of the people that murder and non-fatally shoot officers are AA, and yet only 25% of those killed by police are AA. And by the way, that 37% is carried out by 13% of the population.

@ghuff Publicly available LEOKA reports, 2015-2019 (I don't think the 2020 numbers are available yet). Feel free to double check my work. Would you like to respond to the fact that your "more likely" framing is obfuscatory even using 37%?
@ghuff By closer I mean whenever I use 2015 (you know, post-Ferguson) as a starting point I end up with 38-40%, again as compared with 25% or a little less of persons killed by police.
@ghuff You've concluded how I would respond to a factless hypothetical and stated facts contrary to my written record.\n\nI think we're done.
@ghuff No. Good thing we have investigations.
@ghuff Are you bad at math or lyjng?
@ghuff Are you capable of directly answering a question?
@ghuff A specific 12% of the population is 3x that amount of cop killers and you can't possibly fathom why that would result in them being more than 12% of those cops kill.\n\nAre you serious?
@ghuff Why would police be more present in certain neighborhoods? Let's look at Chicago. https://t.co/MiGOUnajjh

@rcjparry My point is that for the 0.0008% of the total amount of cops who were victims of a felonious murder over a 10-year period, they were 1.5x more likely to be murdered by someone white, and yet they fear for their lives and kill at 3x the rate for African-Americans. Why exactly?

@ghuff @Eugene_Scott Population:
W:65%
AA: 13%

Cop Killers:
W:56%
AA:  37%

Killed by cops:
W:60%
AA:25%

So, your point?

@rcjparry @Eugene_Scott Correct, out of a ten-year period, 56% of people who killed a police officer were white, while 37% of them were African-American, and yet African-Americans are 3 times more like to be shot to death by police than whites. Thatâ€™s the problem.

@ghuff @rcjparry @Eugene_Scott It's closer to 40% of the people that murder/shoot cops are AA, and a reliable 25% of the people shot BY police are AA. AA suspects are more likely to use lethal force on police and more likely to face it in return.
@Eugene_Scott A complete ommission of any relevant context. How (un)surprising. https://t.co/2jNKrM2hpK

Using information from a national database compiled and maintained by The Washington Post, researchers found that victims identifying as people of color, whether armed or unarmed, had significantly higher death rates compared with whites.  https://t.co/xBtrUY7PS9
@Mansexads @Eugene_Scott What's obvious? 35% of cop killers are black. https://t.co/G5UCxFJBDB
